titleStmt.title: Certaine observations concerning the office of the Lord Chancellor composed by the Right Honorable and most learned Thomas, Lord Ellesmere, late Lord Chancellor of England ; whereunto is annexed a perfect table and a methodicall analysis of the whole treatise.

Certaine observations concerning the office of the Lord Chancellor composed by the Right Honorable and most learned Thomas, Lord Ellesmere, late Lord Chancellor of England ; whereunto is annexed a perfect table and a methodicall analysis of the whole treatise.
titleStmt.author: Egerton, Thomas, Sir, 1540?-1617.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Mathhew VValbanck ... Henry Twyford ... and Iohn Place ...,

notesStmt.note: Attribution to Lord Ellesmere considered doubtful. Cf. DNB; Holdsworth, W.S. Sources and literature of English law; Watt, R. Bibl. Brit.
This item appears at reel 56:9 as Wing B4098 (number cancelled in Wing 2nd ed.), and at reel 66:2 as Wing (CD-ROM, 1996) E539.
Reproduction of original in British Library and Huntington Library.
